Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Herakles and the Hydra (of Herakles, only the lion skin remains, of the Hydra, part of the body and tail); below, added red band above a double moulded fillet with band of single black dots on upper, S frieze on lower fillet; red band below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as Alexandria 17206.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 86 no. 290 a pl. 65)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 356-, no. B458, pl. XXVI, pl. CLXXVIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1243) (phase 3)
